page.title: 04WADEBRIDGE CATTLE MARKET
page.content: Wadebridge market was started in{1902} as a result of action by the{ {Mercantile Association}which urged improvement of facilities. The market moved from its original site on{The {Platt}to its present site in{Polmorla {Road}in{1911}.Sales took place in the open pens provided for cattle sheep and pigs. Gradually the committee provided covered accomodation. The auction ring includes a large weighing machine to weigh fat cattle. The market is held each{Monday}. Only one firm of auctioneers is authorised to sell livestock but traders may sell plants, chemicals, medicines and machinery. During{1984}animals passing through the market included{5,324 {bullocks},{3521 calves},{23715 sheep} and{790 pigs}.Periodically horse sales are held.
